title: Bump xmlunit-core from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1
body:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.xmlunit:xmlunit-core&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.8.0&new-version=2.8.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: Fixes exception in preview using regexp search and regexp search without specified field
body:

title: Add error dialog "Problem finding files"
body:
I added an Error Dialog in AutoSetFileLinks. #5890 
I decided to open a pull request in order to get feedback on what I've done. 

This is my first contribution to OpenSource ever, so beware of stupid mistakes.

I am currently trying to go through the motions of contributing. However, I have run into a
few issues:

	 `ERROR org.jabref.logic.l10n.Localization - Messages are not initialized before accessing key: Your current Java version (%0) is not supported. Please install version %1 or higher. - `

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)a
- [x] Tests created for changes (if applicable)
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
- [x] [Checked documentation](https://docs.jabref.org/): Is the information available and up to date? If not: Issue created at <https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues>.
state: open

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
- [ ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [ ] [Checked documentation](https://docs.jabref.org/): Is the information available and up to date? If not: Issue created at <https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues>.
state: open

title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: Bump xmlunit-core from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1
body:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

- #5849

title: Bump xmlunit-core from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1
body:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.xmlunit:xmlunit-core&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.8.0&new-version=2.8.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

title: Bump xmlunit-core from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1
body:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.xmlunit:xmlunit-core&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.8.0&new-version=2.8.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

title: Bump xmlunit-core from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1
body:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

body:

Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-matchers's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: Refine default preview
body:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
body:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
body:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: Add Worldcat fetcher
body:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
body:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.xmlunit:xmlunit-core&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.8.0&new-version=2.8.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)

- [ ] [Checked documentation](https://docs.jabref.org/): Is the information available and up to date? If not: Issue created at <https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues>.

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

number: Fixes exception in preview using regexp search and regexp search without specified field
state:
<!--

If you fixed a koppor issue, link it, e.g. "Fixes https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47".

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
- [ ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [ ] [Checked documentation](https://docs.jabref.org/): Is the information available and up to date? If not: Issue created at <https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues>.

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

- [x] Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
- [x] Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
- [ ] Screenshots added in PR description (for bigger UI changes)
- [ ] [Checked documentation](https://docs.jabref.org/): Is the information available and up to date? If not: Issue created at <https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues>.

title: jabref
state:
Bumps [xmlunit-core](https://github.com/xmlunit/xmlunit) from 2.8.0 to 2.8.1.
Release notes

Sourced from xmlunit-core's releases.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

The only real change when compared to XMLUnit for Java 2.8.0 is the introduction of a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later in order to address a problem with running AssertJ tests in an OSGi environment.

The original xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported.

The full changelog of XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Changelog

Sourced from xmlunit-core's changelog.

XMLUnit for Java 2.8.1 - /Released 2020-11-15/

  • added a new xmlunit-assertj3 module that requires AssertJ 3.18.1 or later.

    This module no longer uses AssertJ internal classes that are not exported to OSGi environments and thus fixes issue #203.

    The module (like AssertJ 3.x itself) requires Java 8 at runtime and is similar to xmlunit-assertj but is no drop-in replacement. It uses a different Java package from xmlunit-assertj and CompareAssert will no longer throw a JUnit 4.x ComparisonException but an opentest4j AssertionFailedError instead.

    The existing xmlunit-assertj module will still be supported in future releases but expect AssertJ 3.x specific changes to only get applied to xmlunit-assertj3.

    Many thanks to @Zegveld, @scordio and @joel-costigliola.

Commits
  • 4f40e46 cut XMLUnit 2.8.1
  • 36470a1 document xmlunit-assertj3 module. closes #203
  • d62805d migrated to travis-ci.com
  • 7da8ed8 update javadocs for xmlunit-assertj3
  • 39e8e9a update release notes for #203
  • a1b5ea4 Merge pull request #206 from rigd-loxia/main
  • cfec6b1 #205: escape '%'-signs for further handling in assertj.
  • 6e1f83d Use the now protected isElementOfCustomAssert, see #203
  • 70df913 hello is the expanded reference, nit xyzzy
  • 18e329e prepare for isElementOfCustomAssert becoming protected - see #203
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.xmlunit:xmlunit-core&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=2.8.0&new-version=2.8.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fixes exception in preview using regexp search and regexp search without specified field
state:
<!-- 
Describe the changes you have made here: what, why, ...

If you fixed a koppor issue, link it, e.g. "Fixes https://github.com/koppor/jabref/issues/47".

-->
Fixes #6777 . The issue originates in how the JavaScript regexp is created in `PreviewViewer#highlightSearchPattern`.

1. Fixes the use of regexp while searching for one term (e.g., `Liu.*`)
2. Fixes exception in the preview when forward slash is used in the regexp
