title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

title: jabref
number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131

title: jabref
state:
This applies the quick fix proposed at https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/7083. To implement the full functionality a longer thought on previews is requried.

I think, the first proposal is a good step towards a better preview: Show the full names of authors and editors, to list the editor only if no author is present, have the year ealier. 

I disliked the default preview style, but could not make any (good) proposal. We need to keep the custom preview, because humanities have special requirements not met by CSL (especially displaying the comments field, ...)

number: Fix Google Scholar fetcher for downloading a single entry
state:
GoogleScholar changed their page (IMHO)

First page:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176330-98d8cd80-1ef8-11eb-804b-2bc7b09b62da.png)

## Second "page"

Click on cited loads the content of that thing:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176346-a42bf900-1ef8-11eb-931b-bdf420873315.png)

There, BibTeX can be downloaded as usual.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98176998-f7527b80-1ef9-11eb-8257-2589dd44b355.png)

Example URL: https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=cite&scirp=0&hl=en

## Third page

Example URL: https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar.bib?q=info:RExzBa3OlkQJ:scholar.google.com/&output=citation&scisdr=CgVYZoPbEOvJ014vy3E:AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq03ED_BBuflXyRuQujflFTqExM8uU&scisig=AAGBfm0AAAAAX6Mq0_wSs1k5gywcNDtaUBn0PeTKsRGQ&scisf=4&ct=citation&cd=-1&hl=en

Block notice:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1366654/98177028-089b8800-1efa-11eb-97c8-329728a7ac16.png)

## Summary

While programming, I came to the last step. The issue is that after 10 tries, I am banned and cannot continue.

title: jabref
number: Fix exception when saving and autosave trigger at the same time
state:
Fixes #6684
Fixes  #6644 
Fixes #6102
Fixes #6000 

Summary:
Manual save + autosave produce an exception/race condition on saving, because both want to access the same file for moving the temp file to the target file.

Solution: Throttle multiple saving operations in a kind of queue

title: jabref
state:
Add EntryBased fetcher for the Worldcat databse (#2581, #1065)

Problem right now is the API key. Tried requesting a sandbox key, but the request was denied. However I believe you being a trusted organisation might have better luck. You can request a key [at this link](https://www.oclc.org/developer/develop/authentication/how-to-request-a-wskey.en.html). The key can be added at [this line](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/compare/master...augustjanse:worldcat-fetcher#diff-81925a19f0349951de113d912a0747a6R25)

Have tested the fetcher and importer with XML content from their [test api](https://platform.worldcat.org/api-explorer/apis/wcapi/Bib/OpenSearch), which has yield successful results

title: jabref
number: Integrates fetching citation counts online (Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations), integrates a general structure for fechting reference metadata and integrates a general websocket server for JabRef
state:
This PR integrates fetching citation counts online from Google Scholar, Semantic Scholar and OpenCitations, as well as a general structure for fechting reference metadata. Furthermore it integrates a general websocket server for JabRef, which currently communicates with the JabRef-Browser-Extension (JabFox) for fetching citation counts from Google Scholar.

References:
- #5849
- https://github.com/JabRef/JabRef-Browser-Extension/pull/131
